00020 /**
00021  * \file  BgpFile.cpp
00022  * \brief Definition of the BGP file profile
00023  *        Read \link file-format-tsv the TsvFile docs \endlink more about TsvFile.
00024  */
00025 
00026 /**
00027 \page file-format-bgp File Format: BGP (NON-OFFICIAL-RELEASE)
00028 
00029 <center><b>DRAFT</b></center>
00030 
00031 The BGP (background probe file) lists which probes to use for background correction.
00032 Currently this file is used with the PM-GCBG pm adjustment method implemented in
00033 apt-probeset-summarize.
00034 
00035 The BGP file is based on version 1 of the \link file-format-tsv TSV file format \endlink.
00036 
00037 \section specs Specs & Features
00038 
00039 - Required headers
00040   - chip_type: indicates the chip type (as stored in the CEL file) which the clf file
00041     describes. Multiple chip_type headers may be present indicating the clf file
00042     can be used with any one of the listed chip types.
00043   - lib_set_name: indicates the name of a collection of related library files for a given
00044     chip. For example, PGF and CLF files intended to be used together should have
00045     the same lib_set_name. Only a single lib_set_name is allowed.
00046   - lib_set_version: indicates the version of a collection of related library files for
00047     a given chip. For example, PGF and CLF files intended to be used together should have
00048     the same lib_set_version. Only a single lib_set_version is allowed.
00049 - Optional headers
00050   - create_date: timestamp for when the file was created
00051   - guid: a unique identifier for the fileA
00052   - other headers may be present
00053 - Required columns
00054   - probe_id: the ID of the probe to use for background correction
00055 - Optional columns
00056   - probeset_id: The ID of the probeset in the PGF file to which the probe belongs. When
00057     using a bgp file with a CDF file, the probe ID is in column major order starting at
00058     1. See \link VIGNETTE-expression-mask-probes \endlink for more details.
00059   - probeset_type: See type field at probeset level in PGF documentation
00060   - atom_id: The ID of the atom to which the probe belongs to
00061   - probe_type: See type field at the probe level in PGF documentation
00062   - gc_count: The numbers of G's and C's in the probe
00063   - probe_length: The length of the probe in base pairs
00064   - probe_sequence: See the probe_sequence info in the PGF documentation
00065   - x: The column coordinate of the probe in the CEL file
00066   - y: The row coordinate of the probe in the CEL file
00067   - other columns may be present
00068 
00069 \section implementation Parsing and Writing
00070 
00071 The official C++ parser used by affy can be found in APT under
00072 sdk/file/TsvFile/BgpFile.h. When possible, parsing and
00073 writing of BGP files should be done using this code.
00074 
00075 \section notes Notes
00076 
00077 The optional fields listed above are frequently present. This is in part due to the fact that
00078 apt-dump-pgf is used to generate the BGP files.
00079 
00080 \section bgpExample1 Example 1
00081 
00082 \verbatim
00083 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-v2
00084 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-v1
00085 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-ta1
00086 #%lib_set_name=HuEx-1_0-st
00087 #%lib_set_version=r2
00088 #%create_date=Tue Sep 19 15:18:05 PDT 2006
00089 #%guid=0000008635-1158704285-2136082293-1007618462-0634896595
00090 probeset_id probeset_type atom_id probe_id probe_type gc_count probe_length probe_sequence x y
00091 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 78973 pm:st 4 25 TATTAAAATTAGAGCTATTAACAAT 2172 30
00092 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 125043 pm:st 4 25 AACTTATCTAAATGCTATTAAAAAT 2162 48
00093 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 148149 pm:st 4 25 TGATATAATAAGCTAATTTGTTTAA 2228 57
00094 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 152379 pm:st 4 25 ATTATAATAGTTAGCAACTTAATAT 1338 59
00095 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 178557 pm:st 4 25 CATTTATTAGTATTAAAGCAAATAT 1916 69
00096 4057134 control->bgp->antigenomic 70013 178785 pm:st 4 25 AATTATTAAAACAAGCTTATATATC 2144 69
00097 \endverbatim
00098 
00099 \section related Related Pages
00100 
00101 - <a href="./file-format-tsv-notes.html">TsvFile Design Notes</a>
00102 - <a href="./file-format-tsv.html">TSV File Format</a>
00103 
00104 */
00105 
00106 #include "file/TsvFile/BgpFile.h"
00107 
00108 
00109 // declare the namespacen
00110 namespace affx
00111 {
00112 
00113 /// @brief     Create the BgpFile object
00114 BgpFile::BgpFile()
00115 {
00116   clear();
00117   makeBgpBindings();
00118 }
00119 /// @brief     Destroy a BgpFile object
00120 BgpFile::~BgpFile()
00121 {
00122 }
00123 
00124 void BgpFile::clear()
00125 {
00126   probe_id=0;
00127   probeset_id_1=0;
00128   atom_id=0;
00129   exon_position=0;
00130   gc_count=0;
00131         interrogation_position=0;
00132         probe_length=0;
00133   probe_sequence="";
00134   probeset_id_2=0;
00135         probeset_name="";
00136         type="";
00137         x=0;
00138         y=0;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /// @brief     Make the bindings which define a BGP file
00142 void BgpFile::makeBgpBindings()
00143 {
00144   m_tsv.unbindAll();
00145   //
00146   m_tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probe_id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00147   m_tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probeset_id_1);
00148   m_tsv.bind(0, "atom_id", &atom_id);
00149   m_tsv.bind(0, "exon_position", &exon_position);
00150   m_tsv.bind(0, "gc_count", &gc_count);
00151   m_tsv.bind(0, "interrogation_position", &interrogation_position);
00152   m_tsv.bind(0, "probe_length", &probe_length);
00153   m_tsv.bind(0, "probe_sequence", &probe_sequence);
00154   //m_tsv.bind(0,8,&probeset_id_2);
00155   m_tsv.bind(0, "probeset_name", &probeset_name);
00156   m_tsv.bind(0, "type", &type);
00157   m_tsv.bind(0, "x", &x);
00158   m_tsv.bind(0, "y", &y);
00159 }
00160 
00161 /// @brief     Open a BGP file
00162 /// @param     filename     the pathname of the file
00163 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00164 int BgpFile::open(const std::string& filename)
00165 {
00166   return m_tsv.open(filename);
00167 }
00168 /// @brief     Start the write to a file
00169 /// @param     filename
00170 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00171 int BgpFile::write(const std::string& filename)
00172 {
00173   return m_tsv.writeTsv(filename);
00174 }
00175 /// @brief     Close a PGF file
00176 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00177 int BgpFile::close()
00178 {
00179   return m_tsv.close();
00180 }
00181 /// @brief     Rewind back to the start of the BGP data
00182 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00183 int BgpFile::rewind()
00184 {
00185   return m_tsv.rewind();
00186 }
00187 /// @brief     Skip to the next probe
00188 /// @returns   TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of probesets
00189 int BgpFile::next_bgprobe()
00190 {
00191   return m_tsv.nextLevel(0);
00192 }
00193 /// @brief     Define a tsv file as a BGP file.
00194 /// @param     tsv       pointer to tsv to define
00195 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00196 int BgpFile::defineFileBgp(TsvFile* tsv)
00197 {
00198   assert(tsv != NULL);
00199   return tsv->defineFile("probe_id\tprobeset_id\tatom_id\texon_position\t"
00200                          "gc_count\tinterrogation_position\tprobe_length\t"
00201                          "probe_sequence\tprobeset_id\tprobeset_name\ttype\tx\ty");
00202 }
00203 /// @brief     Define this file as a pgf file
00204 /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00205 int BgpFile::defineFileBgp()
00206 {
00207   return defineFileBgp(&m_tsv);
00208 }
00209 
00210 };
